intro: Lettsomia confusa var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed lettsomia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. This variant is distinguished by its shorter pedicels compared to other varieties within the species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, tropical environments.
